questions.question: Which is the most popular JavaScript framework?
questions.explanation: React has the largest community, ecosystem, and job demand, making it the most popular JS framework/library today.

questions.question: Which company invented React?
questions.explanation: React was created at Facebook (now Meta) to solve UI performance issues in their apps like Facebook and Instagram.

questions.question: What's the fundamental building block of React apps?
questions.explanation: React apps are built from components â€” reusable pieces of UI that manage their own logic and rendering.

questions.question: What's the name of the syntax we use to describe the UI in React components?
questions.explanation: JSX lets you write HTML-like syntax inside JavaScript, making UI easier to build and understand.

questions.question: How does data flow naturally in React apps?
questions.explanation: React is designed for one-way data flow: parent components pass data down to child components.

questions.question: How to pass data into a child component?
questions.explanation: Props are the mechanism used to pass data from parents to children in React.

questions.question: When to use derived state?

options.text: When it can be computed from other state

questions.explanation: Derived state is used when the value can be computed from existing state instead of being stored separately.

questions.question: What triggers a UI re-render in React?
questions.explanation: Re-rendering happens whenever state updates, because React needs to recalculate the UI based on the new state.

questions.question: When do we directly "touch" the DOM in React?
questions.explanation: React abstracts the DOM. Direct manipulation is rare and usually done only with refs.

questions.question: In what situation do we use a callback to update state?

options.text: When updates need to be instant
When new state depends on previous state

questions.explanation: Functional updates are used when the new state depends on the previous state.
